info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 3:01PM MST until October 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, east central Pima.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 301 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Drexel Heights, South Tucson, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, San Xavier Community, Tucson International Airport, Summit, Valencia West, Tucson Mountain Park, Tucson Estates, Saguaro National Park East, Rita Ranch and San Xavier Mission. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
